TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON GPE , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently detained in the Straubing correctional facility ( GPE ) . He was represented before the ORG by Mr O. PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant was remanded in custody ( vorläufig festgenommen ) on suspicion of attempted homicide . On DATE he was placed in pre - trial detention on the basis of an arrest warrant issued by ORG on DATE .

On DATE , at the public prosecutor ’s request , PERSON , a physician , gave an initial psychiatric expert opinion on the applicant , stating that the requirements of LAW ( diminished criminal liability – verminderte PERSON ) were met . However , he further stated that the requirements of LAW ( placement in an alcohol detoxification clinic GPE in einer GPE ) were not fulfilled .

On DATE the PERSON public prosecutor ’s office issued a bill of indictment indicating that , on account of his previous convictions , the applicant met the requirements for placement in compulsory confinement ( GPE ) under LAW of LAW ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) .

On DATE the applicant ’s defence counsel requested access to the applicant ’s present and previous case files in order to prepare his defence . He stated that , in view of the applicant ’s possible placement in compulsory confinement , it was necessary to have access to the case files relating to his previous convictions . Furthermore , he requested an expert opinion on the question whether the requirements of LAW regarding compulsory confinement were met in the applicant ’s case .
On DATE the ORG opened the main proceedings ( Eröffnung des Hauptverfahrens ) .
On DATE it granted the defence counsel access to the file concerning the present case as well as those concerning CARDINAL previous convictions . The defence counsel received those files on DATE .
On DATE the ORG set the case down for hearing on DATE and summoned witnesses and PERSON to appear on that date .
On DATE the public prosecutor ’s office asked for an expert opinion on the question whether the requirements of LAW were met .

On DATE ORG requested the case files regarding the applicant ’s previous CARDINAL convictions . The court received CARDINAL of these files , CARDINAL of which contained only the judgments ( PERSON ) or sentence orders ( PERSON ) , but no other documents . The court was unable to obtain the other case files . On DATE the public prosecutor ’s office requested a supplementary expert opinion on the question whether the requirements for placement in compulsory confinement were met .

On DATE PERSON submitted his expert opinion to the public prosecutor ’s office . On DATE the defence counsel received a copy . It comprised CARDINAL pages , CARDINAL of which were dedicated to the expert ’s conclusion that the requirements of LAW were met . On DATE , DATE , the applicant ’s defence counsel also received the case files relating to the CARDINAL previous convictions .

On DATE the defence counsel requested the adjournment of the trial ( Aussetzung des ORG ) , relying on LAW ( b ) of the LAW . He argued that he had not had enough time to prepare the applicant ’s defence . The court rejected his request , stating that the defence counsel had known since the bill of indictment had been served that the issue of compulsory confinement would form the subject matter of the trial . Furthermore , it observed that there had been no change of circumstances ( ORG ) that might have justified an adjournment in accordance with LAW , paragraph ( CARDINAL ) , of LAW . It also pointed out that the expert opinion had been ordered at the applicant ’s request . The court further noted that the expert ’s written submissions had been much less important than his oral remarks during the hearing . The applicant ’s defence counsel also requested the taking of further evidence .

The trial was resumed on DATE . PERSON delivered his expert opinion and was questioned by the applicant ’s defence counsel . On a motion by the defence counsel , the court ordered a supplementary psychological expert assessment , to be carried out by a second expert , T.
On DATE the court ordered the CARDINAL experts to deliver their opinions on DATE . T. conducted a psychological assessment of the applicant on DATE and produced his written opinion on DATE .

During the last hearing on DATE , PERSON gave an oral presentation of his psychological assessment . PERSON then made supplementary statements regarding his own opinion and ORG ’s assessment . The applicant ’s defence counsel subsequently requested an additional expert opinion . His motion was CARDINAL pages long and included comments on PERSON ’s opinion . However , the court rejected the request as unnecessary , as it considered the expert ’s opinion convincing .

The court then closed the procedure for taking evidence and later delivered its judgment . It convicted the applicant of attempted homicide and of having caused grievous bodily harm by one and the same act ( versuchter Totschlag in GPE gefährlicher ORG and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . Moreover , the applicant was placed in compulsory confinement . The court stated that the requirements of LAW were met , taking into consideration the applicant ’s present and previous convictions . It concluded that the applicant had to be considered dangerous and that placing him in compulsory confinement was a proportionate measure .
On DATE ORG dismissed an appeal on points of law by the applicant .
On DATE ORG refused to entertain a constitutional appeal by the applicant .

The Dangerous Habitual Offenders Act ( PERSON gegen gefährliche PERSON ) , which came into force on DATE , provides for certain correctional and preventive measures ( GPE der PERSON ) . These measures are not designed as punishment , but rather as an attempt to prevent future offences by reforming the offenders and thus preserving public order .

The measures are governed by Articles CARDINAL et seq . of LAW . They include placement in a psychiatric hospital , placement in a detoxification clinic ( GPE ) , compulsory confinement , supervision of conduct ( ORG ) , withdrawal of driving licence and prohibition on practising a certain profession . Article CARDINAL provides that the measure has to be proportionate to the offence committed and to the danger presented by the offender . Paragraph ( CARDINAL ) of LAW states that an offender may be placed in compulsory confinement if he has committed CARDINAL intentional offences each of which is punishable by DATE imprisonment and if he has been sentenced to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment for CARDINAL or more of these acts and poses a threat to public order .
Article CARDINAL reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) If a person is convicted of an intentional offence and is sentenced to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment , the court shall place the offender in compulsory confinement in addition to the sentence , if
CARDINAL . NORP the offender has already been sentenced twice to DATE imprisonment for intentional offences before committing the new offence ;
CARDINAL . NORP the offender has served a prison sentence of DATE for those previous convictions or has been detained as a correctional or preventive measure ; and

CARDINAL . an assessment of the offender and his offences shows that he poses a threat to the general public owing to his inclination to commit serious offences , in particular those which inflict severe psychological and physical damage on the victims or which cause severe economic damage .

( CARDINAL ) If a person has committed CARDINAL intentional offences , each of which is punishable by DATE imprisonment , and has been sentenced to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment for CARDINAL or more of these offences , the court may , under the provision indicated in paragraph ( CARDINAL ) , point CARDINAL , above , place the applicant in compulsory confinement in addition to the sentence even in the absence of a previous conviction or deprivation of liberty ( paragraph ( CARDINAL ) , points CARDINAL and CARDINAL , above ) . ... ”
Paragraph ( CARDINAL ) of Article CARDINAL reads as follows :

“ If a prison sentence is served before placement in compulsory confinement , the court shall examine , towards the end of the sentence being served , whether the aim of the measure still requires placement in compulsory confinement . ”

Former Article GPE limited the length of compulsory confinement to DATE . It was amended by the Sixth LAW ( Sechstes Gesetz zur Reform des Strafrechts ) , which came into force on DATE , and the new Sexual and Other LAW ( Gesetz zur PERSON und anderen gefährlichen ORG ) .
Paragraph ( CARDINAL ) of the new Article CARDINAL reads as follows :

“ After DATE in compulsory confinement has been completed , the court shall declare the measure to be terminated , as long as there is no danger that the detainee will , owing to his inclination to crime , commit further serious offences which would risk inflicting severe psychological and physical damage on the victims . If the measure is considered to have been terminated , the detainee shall be placed under supervision of conduct . ”

Section CARDINAL of LAW to LAW states that the new Article GPE applies without any temporal limitations , and hence retrospectively . Article CARDINAL states that the court may examine of its own motion at any given time whether the execution of a measure of compulsory confinement could be suspended on probation , but it is required to do so at least every DATE .
